made it  |  2 reviews Recipe by: Chef John "There's much debate over how many of America's greatest recipes got their name, but that's not an issue with Oysters Rockefeller. Thanks to the rich, money-colored butter sauce, this decadent creation's name pretty much wrote itself. Serve with a squeeze of fresh lemon over the top." Added to shopping list. Go to shopping list.

2 cups rock salt, or more as needed ADVERTISEMENT 1 cup chopped watercress ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 cup butter, room temperature ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 cup bread crumbs ADVERTISEMENT 2 tablespoons minced green onion (white and pale green parts only) ADVERTISEMENT 2 tablespoons chopped celery ADVERTISEMENT 2 tablespoons chopped fresh tarragon ADVERTISEMENT 2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley ADVERTISEMENT 2 tablespoons anise-flavored liqueur (such as Pernod®) ADVERTISEMENT 1 pinch cayenne pepper, or to taste ADVERTISEMENT salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste ADVERTISEMENT 36 oysters on the half shell ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 40 m Cook 15 m Ready In 55 m Preheat an oven to 500 degrees F (260 degrees C). Pour rock salt into a large, shallow casserole dish. Combine watercress, butter, bread crumbs, green onions, celery, tarragon, Italian parsley, anise-flavored liqueur, salt, black pepper, and cayenne pepper in a food processor; blend until smooth. Place 8 to 12 shucked oysters on top of the rock salt. Spoon 1 to 2 teaspoons of watercress mixture a top each oyster. Bake in the preheated oven until oysters are firm and butter has melted, about 5 minutes. Repeat with remaining oysters.
http://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/250x250/46338.jpg

made it  |  637 reviews Recipe by: LeAnn "This recipe was given to me by a friend several years ago. It's easy to make and always a hit! Co-workers beg for it, and it's my husband's favorite!" Added to shopping list. Go to shopping list.

1 pound pork sausage ADVERTISEMENT 1 (8 ounce) package refrigerated crescent roll dough ADVERTISEMENT 8 eggs, beaten ADVERTISEMENT 2 cups shredded mozzarella cheese ADVERTISEMENT 2 cups shredded Cheddar cheese ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon dried oregano ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 15 m Cook 35 m Ready In 50 m Place sausage in a large, deep skillet. Cook over medium-high heat until evenly brown. Drain, crumble, and set aside. Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Lightly grease a 9x13 inch baking dish. Line the bottom of the prepared baking dish with crescent roll dough, and sprinkle with crumbled sausage. In a large bowl, mix beaten eggs, mozzarella, and Cheddar. Season the mixture with oregano, and pour over the sausage and crescent rolls. Bake 25 to 30 minutes in the preheated oven, or until a knife inserted in the center comes out clean.
http://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/250x250/509474.jpg
made it  |  931 reviews Recipe by: JEANIE BEAN "It's old fashioned, it's comforting, it makes the kitchen smell wonderful and it's good for the soul." Added to shopping list. Go to shopping list.

1/3 cup unsweetened cocoa powder ADVERTISEMENT 3/4 cup white sugar ADVERTISEMENT 1 pinch salt ADVERTISEMENT 1/3 cup boiling water ADVERTISEMENT 3 1/2 cups milk ADVERTISEMENT 3/4 teaspoon vanilla extract ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 cup half-and-half cream ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 2 m Cook 5 m Ready In 7 m Combine the cocoa, sugar and pinch of salt in a saucepan. Blend in the boiling water. Bring this mixture to an easy boil while you stir. Simmer and stir for about 2 minutes. Watch that it doesn't scorch. Stir in 3 1/2 cups of milk and heat until very hot, but do not boil! Remove from heat and add vanilla. Divide between 4 mugs. Add the cream to the mugs of cocoa to cool it to drinking temperature.
http://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/250x250/696723.jpg

made it  |  565 reviews Recipe by: lelainem10 "When I was a little girl, my mother would always make us crepes on Sundays. I also loved the smell of vanilla when my mother would make her cookies. So, I would always ask her to make her cookies, and when she refused, I would take out the vanilla and sit it next to me with the cap open, so that I could breathe the aroma. My mother get a kick out of this, and said, well, if it's that important, we'll add a little vanilla kick, just for you. After the first time she put the vanilla in, there was never a last...it became a tradition." Added to shopping list. Go to shopping list.

1 1/2 cups milk ADVERTISEMENT 3 egg yolks ADVERTISEMENT 2 tablespoons vanilla extract ADVERTISEMENT 1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour ADVERTISEMENT 2 tablespoons sugar ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 teaspoon salt ADVERTISEMENT 5 tablespoons melted butter ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 10 m Cook 20 m Ready In 30 m In a large bowl, mix together the milk, egg yolks and vanilla. Stir in the flour, sugar, salt and melted butter until well blended. Heat a crepe pan over medium heat until hot. Coat with vegetable oil or cooking spray. Pour about 1/4 cup of batter into the pan and tip to spread the batter to the edges. When bubbles form on the top and the edges are dry, flip over and cook until lightly browned on the other side and edges are golden. Repeat with remaining batter. Fill crepes with your favorite fruit, cream, caramel or even ice cream or cheese to serve.
http://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/250x250/116544.jpg

made it  |  532 reviews Recipe by: Jen "Cabbage and onions are sauteed in bacon grease, and served with a splash of vinegar, for a tangy, hearty dish that will surprise you." Added to shopping list. Go to shopping list.

3 slices bacon, chopped ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 cup chopped onion ADVERTISEMENT 6 cups cabbage, cut into thin wedges ADVERTISEMENT 2 tablespoons water ADVERTISEMENT 1 pinch white sugar ADVERTISEMENT salt and pepper to taste ADVERTISEMENT 1 tablespoon cider vinegar ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 20 m Cook 25 m Ready In 45 m Place bacon in a large, deep skillet. Cook over medium-high heat until evenly brown. Remove bacon, and set aside. Cook onion in the hot bacon grease until tender. Add cabbage, and stir in water, sugar, salt, and pepper. Cook until cabbage wilts, about 15 minutes. Stir in bacon. Splash with vinegar before serving.
http://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/250x250/949777.jpg

made it  |  702 reviews Recipe by: Erin Nesbit "This French delicacy is extremely versatile, as it can be filled with virtually anything -- fruits, pudding, mousse for desserts as well as vegetables and meats for dinner. No need to add more oil each time unless the pan begins to stick. Freeze extra crepes for later use." Added to shopping list. Go to shopping list.

2 eggs ADVERTISEMENT 1 cup milk ADVERTISEMENT 2/3 cup all-purpose flour ADVERTISEMENT 1 pinch salt ADVERTISEMENT 1 1/2 teaspoons vegetable oil ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 5 m Cook 15 m Ready In 1 h 20 m In a blender combine eggs, milk, flour, salt and oil. Process until smooth. Cover and refrigerate 1 hour. Heat a skillet over medium-high heat and brush with oil. Pour 1/4 cup of crepe batter into pan, tilting to completely coat the surface of the pan. Cook 2 to 5 minutes, turning once, until golden. Repeat with remaining batter.
http://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/560x315/2998578.jpg

2 (12 ounce) packages refrigerated biscuit dough ADVERTISEMENT 1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese, softened ADVERTISEMENT 1 (6 ounce) can crab meat, drained ADVERTISEMENT 2 tablespoons mayonnaise ADVERTISEMENT 2 tablespoons grated Parmesan cheese ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 cup shredded Cheddar cheese ADVERTISEMENT 2 tablespoons thinly sliced green onion ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce ADVERTISEMENT 1 pinch paprika ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 10 m Cook 20 m Ready In 30 m Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Lightly grease 12 tartlet pans. Divide rolls in half and press into the prepared tartlet pans. Set aside. In a large bowl, combine cream cheese, crab, mayonnaise, Parmesan cheese, Cheddar cheese, green onions and Worcestershire sauce. Spoon 1 teaspoon of mixture into tarts and garnish with paprika. Bake at 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) for 15 to 20 minutes, or until light brown. These freeze wonderfully. Just reheat before serving.
http://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/560x315/580469.jpg

made it  |  712 reviews Recipe by: Valerie Lynne "Just imagine a cute display of penguins, made with black olives, carrots and cream cheese! You can add scarves and hats by using fresh red pepper strips, or canned pimentos cut into different shapes. Use frilly toothpicks if you can." Added to shopping list. Go to shopping list.

18 jumbo black olives, pitted ADVERTISEMENT 1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese, softened ADVERTISEMENT 18 small black olives ADVERTISEMENT 1 carrot ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 30 m Ready In 35 m Cut a slit from top to bottom, lengthwise, into the side of each jumbo olive. Carefully insert about 1 teaspoon of cream cheese into each olive. Slice the carrot into eighteen 1/4 inch thick rounds; cut a small notch out of each carrot slice to form feet. Save the cut out piece and press into center of small olive to form the beak. If necessary cut a small slit into each olive before inserting the beak. Set a big olive, large hole side down, onto a carrot slice. Then, set a small olive onto the large olive, adjusting so that the beak, cream cheese chest and notch in the carrot slice line up. Secure with a toothpick.
http://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/560x315/5880.jpg

12 slices bacon ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 cup butter, melted ADVERTISEMENT 3 cups croutons ADVERTISEMENT 2 cups grated Cheddar cheese ADVERTISEMENT 6 eggs ADVERTISEMENT 1 3/4 cups milk ADVERTISEMENT 1 bell pepper (any color), diced ADVERTISEMENT 1 tablespoon prepared mustard ADVERTISEMENT salt and pepper to taste ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 20 m Cook 50 m Ready In 1 h 20 m Place bacon in a large, deep skillet. Cook over medium high heat until evenly brown. Drain, crumble and set aside. Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Melt butter in the microwave, or in a small pan on the stove over low heat. Spray a 9x12 inch baking dish with vegetable spray. Place croutons in the bottom of the dish, and drizzle with melted butter. Sprinkle with grated Cheddar cheese. Crack the eggs into a bowl, whisking to break up the yolks. Add milk, peppers, mustard, salt, and pepper, and beat until well-combined. Pour over the croutons and cheese, and sprinkle with crumbled bacon. Bake in the preheated oven for 40 minutes. Remove from oven and allow to stand 10 minutes before serving.
http://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/560x315/827152.jpg

4 eggs, lightly beaten ADVERTISEMENT 1 1/3 cups milk ADVERTISEMENT 2 tablespoons butter, melted ADVERTISEMENT 1 cup all-purpose flour ADVERTISEMENT 2 tablespoons white sugar ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 teaspoon salt ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 10 m Cook 10 m Ready In 20 m In large bowl, whisk together eggs, milk, melted butter, flour sugar and salt until smooth. Heat a medium-sized skillet or crepe pan over medium heat. Grease pan with a small amount of butter or oil applied with a brush or paper towel. Using a serving spoon or small ladle, spoon about 3 tablespoons crepe batter into hot pan, tilting the pan so that bottom surface is evenly coated. Cook over medium heat, 1 to 2 minutes on a side, or until golden brown. Serve immediately.

1 egg white ADVERTISEMENT 1 tablespoon water ADVERTISEMENT 1 pound pecan halves ADVERTISEMENT 1 cup white sugar ADVERTISEMENT 3/4 teaspoon salt ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Preheat oven to 250 degrees F (120 degrees C). Grease one baking sheet. In a mixing bowl, whip together the egg white and water until frothy. In a separate bowl, mix together sugar, salt, and cinnamon. Add pecans to egg whites, stir to coat the nuts evenly. Remove the nuts, and toss them in the sugar mixture until coated. Spread the nuts out on the prepared baking sheet. Bake at 250 degrees F (120 degrees C) for 1 hour. Stir every 15 minutes.
http://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/250x250/691320.jpg

And the best part - I usually end up with leftover stuffing, which freezes beautifully until the next carry-in!" Added to shopping list. Go to shopping list.

2 tablespoons butter ADVERTISEMENT 2 tablespoons minced green onion ADVERTISEMENT 1 cup cooked crabmeat, finely chopped ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 cup dry bread crumbs ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 cup shredded Monterey Jack cheese ADVERTISEMENT 1 egg, beaten ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon lemon juice ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 teaspoon dried dill weed ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 cup butter, melted ADVERTISEMENT 1 1/2 pounds fresh button mushrooms, stems removed ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 cup shredded Monterey Jack cheese ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 cup dry white wine ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 20 m Cook 20 m Ready In 40 m Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Melt 2 tablespoons butter in a skillet; cook and stir green onion until softened, about 2 minutes. Transfer green onion to a bowl. Stir in crabmeat, bread crumbs, 1/4 cup Monterey Jack cheese, egg, lemon juice, and dill weed until well mixed. Pour 1/2 cup melted butter in a 9x13-inch baking dish; turn mushroom caps in butter to coat. Fill mushroom caps with the crab mixture and sprinkle with remaining 1/2 cup Monterey Jack cheese. Pour white wine into baking dish. Bake in preheated oven until cheese is melted and lightly brown, 15 to 20 minutes.
http://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/250x250/490832.jpg

1 bunch kale ADVERTISEMENT 1 tablespoon olive oil ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon seasoned salt ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 10 m Cook 10 m Ready In 20 m Preheat an oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line a non insulated cookie sheet with parchment paper. With a knife or kitchen shears carefully remove the leaves from the thick stems and tear into bite size pieces. Wash and thoroughly dry kale with a salad spinner. Drizzle kale with olive oil and sprinkle with seasoning salt. Bake until the edges brown but are not burnt, 10 to 15 minutes.

12 whole fresh mushrooms ADVERTISEMENT 1 tablespoon vegetable oil ADVERTISEMENT 1 tablespoon minced garlic ADVERTISEMENT 1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese, softened ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 teaspoon onion powder ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 teaspoon ground cayenne pepper ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 25 m Cook 20 m Ready In 45 m Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Spray a baking sheet with cooking spray. Clean mushrooms with a damp paper towel. Carefully break off stems. Chop stems extremely fine, discarding tough end of stems. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and chopped mushroom stems to the skillet. Fry until any moisture has disappeared, taking care not to burn garlic. Set aside to cool. When garlic and mushroom mixture is no longer hot, stir in cream cheese, Parmesan cheese, black pepper, onion powder and cayenne pepper. Mixture should be very thick. Using a little spoon, fill each mushroom cap with a generous amount of stuffing. Arrange the mushroom caps on prepared cookie sheet. Bake for 20 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the mushrooms are piping hot and liquid starts to form under caps.

1 pound sage flavored breakfast sausage ADVERTISEMENT 3 cups shredded potatoes, drained and pressed ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 cup butter, melted ADVERTISEMENT 12 ounces mild Cheddar cheese, shredded ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 cup onion, shredded ADVERTISEMENT 1 (16 ounce) container small curd cottage cheese ADVERTISEMENT 6 jumbo eggs ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 25 m Cook 1 h 15 m Ready In 1 h 45 m Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Lightly grease a 9x13 inch square baking dish. Place sausage in a large, deep skillet. Cook over medium-high heat until evenly brown. Drain, crumble, and set aside. In the prepared baking dish, stir together the shredded potatoes and butter. Line the bottom and sides of the baking dish with the mixture. In a bowl, mix the sausage, Cheddar cheese, onion, cottage cheese, and eggs. Pour over the potato mixture. Bake 1 hour in the preheated oven, or until a toothpick inserted into center of the casserole comes out clean. Let cool for 5 minutes before serving.

5 sweet potatoes ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 teaspoon salt ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 cup butter ADVERTISEMENT 2 eggs ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon vanilla extract ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 cup white sugar ADVERTISEMENT 2 tablespoons heavy cream ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 cup butter, softened ADVERTISEMENT 3 tablespoons all-purpose flour ADVERTISEMENT 3/4 cup packed light brown sugar ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 cup chopped pecans ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 20 m Cook 1 h 5 m Ready In 1 h 25 m Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease a 9x13 inch baking dish. Bake sweet potatoes 35 minutes in the preheated oven, or until they begin to soften. Cool slightly, peel, and mash. In a large bowl, mix the mashed sweet potatoes, salt, 1/4 cup butter, eggs, vanilla extract, cinnamon, sugar, and heavy cream. Transfer to the prepared baking dish. In a medium bowl, combine 1/4 cup butter, flour, brown sugar, and chopped pecans. Mix with a pastry blender or your fingers to the consistency of course meal. Sprinkle over the sweet potato mixture. Bake 30 minutes in the preheated oven, until topping is crisp and lightly browned.

3/4 pound ground pork sausage ADVERTISEMENT 1 tablespoon butter ADVERTISEMENT 4 green onions, chopped ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 pound fresh mushrooms, sliced ADVERTISEMENT 10 eggs, beaten ADVERTISEMENT 1 (16 ounce) container low-fat cottage cheese ADVERTISEMENT 1 pound Monterey Jack cheese, shredded ADVERTISEMENT 2 (4 ounce) cans diced green chile peppers, drained ADVERTISEMENT 1 cup all-purpose flour ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon baking powder ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 teaspoon salt ADVERTISEMENT 1/3 cup butter, melted ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 20 m Cook 1 h 20 m Ready In 9 h 40 m Place sausage in a large, deep skillet. Cook over medium-high heat until evenly brown. Drain, and set aside. Melt butter in skillet, and cook and stir the green onions and mushrooms until tender. In a large bowl, mix the eggs, cottage cheese, Monterey Jack cheese, and chiles. Stir in the sausage, green onions, and mushrooms. Cover, and refrigerate overnight. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease a 9x13 inch baking dish. In a bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, and salt. Blend in the melted butter. Stir the flour mixture into the egg mixture. Pour into the prepared baking dish. Bake 40 to 50 minutes in the preheated oven, or until lightly brown. Let stand 10 minutes before serving.

1 cup all-purpose flour ADVERTISEMENT 2 eggs ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 cup milk ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 cup water ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 teaspoon salt ADVERTISEMENT 2 tablespoons butter, melted ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 10 m Cook 20 m Ready In 30 m In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the flour and the eggs. Gradually add in the milk and water, stirring to combine. Add the salt and butter; beat until smooth. Heat a lightly oiled griddle or frying pan over medium high heat. Pour or scoop the batter onto the griddle, using approximately 1/4 cup for each crepe. Tilt the pan with a circular motion so that the batter coats the surface evenly. Cook the crepe for about 2 minutes, until the bottom is light brown. Loosen with a spatula, turn and cook the other side. Serve hot.

1 (8 ounce) wheel Brie cheese ADVERTISEMENT 3 tablespoons apricot preserves ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 (17.5 ounce) package frozen puff pastry, thawed ADVERTISEMENT 1 egg white ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 10 m Cook 30 m Ready In 40 m Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease a cookie sheet. Slice one wheel of Brie cheese in half so you have 2 circles of cheese. Spread apricot or peach preserves on (the cut side) half of one circle of brie. Make sandwich out of the two halves of Brie, so that the preserves are in the center of both halves. Wrap the entire wheel of Brie with one sheet of puffed pastry and flip the entire concoction onto the prepared cooking sheet so the seam is on bottom. Brush the puffed pastry with the egg white. Bake for 30 minutes, or until the pastry in golden brown. Serve immediately.

Prep 15 m Cook 40 m Ready In 55 m Preheat oven to 475 degrees F (245 degrees C). In a large bowl, combine the squash, red bell peppers, sweet potato, and Yukon Gold potatoes. Prep 5 m Cook 10 m Ready In 15 m Place the bacon and vegetable oil into a large pot over medium heat. Season with salt and pepper. Cook for about 5 minutes, or until bacon is crisp. Add cabbage, onion, and sugar to the pot; cook and stir continuously for 5 minutes, until tender.
